citation: Agricultural and Veterinary Chemicals (Control of Use) Order 2001 (Tas)
text:
Agricultural and Veterinary Chemicals (Control of Use) Order 2001

I make the following order under sections 20(2)(a) and 27(1) of the Agricultural and Veterinary Chemicals (Control of Use) Act 1995 .

21 February 2001

D. E. LLEWELLYN

Minister for Primary Industries, Water and Environment

1. Short title
    This order may be cited as the Agricultural and Veterinary Chemicals (Control of Use) Order 2001 .

2. Commencement
    This order takes effect on the day on which its making is notified in the Gazette.

3. Interpretation
    In this order, the Acts Interpretation Act 1931 applies to the interpretation of this order as if the order were by-laws.

4. Handling veterinary chemical products
    A chemical product that is a veterinary chemical product must be handled in accordance with the Code of Practice for the Supply and Use of Veterinary Chemical Products published by the Council.

5. Controlling ground agricultural spraying
        (1) Any ground agricultural spraying of agricultural chemical products must be carried out in accordance with the Code of Practice for Ground Spraying published by the Council.
        (2) The specified climatic or seasonal conditions are any climatic or seasonal conditions.
        (3) The area specified to be the chemical control area is the whole of Tasmania.

Displayed and numbered in accordance with the Rules Publication Act 1953.

Notified in the Gazette on 28 February 2001

This order is administered in the Department of Primary Industries, Water and Environment.
